name: Comfort Inn Clifton Hill - Niagara Falls Hotel

reviews.text: My husband, two children and myself spent three nights at the Clifton Hill Comfort Inn. We travelled by train so we did not have a vehicle. The Comfort Inn was in a perfect location. It was just slightly above the hustle and bustle of Clifton Hill. It was also within easy walking distance of everything, including the falls shuttle stop.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay.
Enjoyable stay
reviews.text: The room was small but clean. We had a nice balcony, large enough for us to comfortably watch the fireworks over the falls. (The trees provided some obstruction but we still had a good view.)

reviews.title: Nice but noisy
reviews.text: All staff were extremely helpful. They went out of their way to please. One downfall with this hotel was that it did not have a store where we could buy necessities. That being said, my daughter wanted tape to put mementoes into her journal and the front desk kindly lent us their dispenser.
The pool was small but nice. It has good hours and the children enjoyed it. We were allowed to use the outdoor pool at the Quality Inn across the street. It, too, was nice for the kids.
reviews.title: Older but comfortable.

reviews.text: The continental breakfast was super. It consisted of bagels, muffins, croissants, toast, waffles (delicious waffles, I might add), cold cereal, instant oatmeal, fruit salad, juice, coffee. It was extremely filling. Gone are the days of muffins and juice and coffee.
reviews.title: Cold Pool!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were quite pleased with this hotel - the rates, the ammenities, and the close proximity to the falls were all great. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and would absolutely stay at one of the Comfort Inn chains in the future.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

likes.liked: — Free parking, free breakfast, proximity to Niagara Falls
likes.disliked: — No elevator, no mini fridge in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Likes: Free parking, free deluxe continental breakfast (waffles were amazing!), rates, 1 block from the falls, included in the Qantas frequent flyer program.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dislikes: No elevator, no mini fridge in the room (however, you could bring a cooler and fill it with ice to keep a container of milk cold.
reviews.title: great value for money

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. Our stay was excellent. The reason we chose this hotel is its location and its proximity to attractions. This hotel is right in the middle of Clifton hill. After coming back from the trip, I would strongly advise booking a room in Clifton Hill area.
reviews.title: Good for young families

likes.disliked: — sometimes had trouble finding parking near our hotel door, too many steps

reviews.title: Good central family spot
reviews.text: The hotel is two blocks away from the Maid of the Mist boat ride. Candian Falls are around 10 - 15 minute walk. We used to walk every night to see the falls in lights. Clifton Hill is filled with restaurants and fun for all ages.

We stayed at the Comfort Inn Clifton Hill in mid October 2006. All the positive things said on this website were true. The hotel room was well kept up, clean. The beds were very comfortable. We have a 1 yr old toddler so I know for a fact that floor was even clean! I am extremely picky about a clean hotel too. There are 2 small wings where there are balconies - one set facing the mini-golf and one inside facing the pool. We were lucky enough to get the mini-golf side and the window faced the huge ferris wheel which our daughter loved.
reviews.title: Comfort Inn was comfortable indeed!

likes.disliked: — Did not bother me, but there is no elevator

reviews.text: The breakfast quality was good. Waffles, cereal, fruit salad, toast and muffins. Very friendly staff and of course a great location. I would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Value & Clean

likes.liked: — It was Clean and the Breakfast was good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Husband added that you can pop down to the pub (kelsey's) for a drink without leaving the hotel - very convenient!
reviews.title: great hotel
As good as they say
reviews.text: Fantastic but thank goodness for Tripadvisor. We almost booked a dive of a hotel. Luckily we checked the reviews and they were right. Very Clean, Good location and good breakfast included in the price. Fruit, bagels, waffles cereal and toast. Our beds were 2 normal sized doubles but were large enough. We travelled with the 2 children and had ground floor rooms so not far to carry cases and tired children. Right in the centre of the action but quiet too. Close enough to walk to all attractions easily. I was very pleased. thanks to everyone who puts reviews on tripadvisor!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was great: located in the center of niagara falls a few minutes walk from the falls. The parking is free and very convenient.
reviews.title: Great value, convenient location

likes.liked: — price for what you get, easy walking distance to many attractions

reviews.text: Just went to Niagara Falls Aug 17-20 for our 25th anniversary(sort of) we celebrated in Maui in February but had to do something on the actual weekend, so we took our daughter and her boyfriend and had a great time.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Value

likes.liked: — location- short walk to falls & Maid of the Mist
likes.disliked: — queen size beds, mini fridge & microwave should be offered -add scrambled eggs to buffet -the should offer Jacuzzi rooms too

reviews.title: Highly Recommend
reviews.text: I think it is quite silly that we Americans don't allow our adult children to drink, even though they go to war, vote, can get married and have kids. I took my daughter to Europe a few years ago and enjoyed having her be able to go to taverns with us. We also enjoyed this in Canada. We ate and drank at Yanks - very good food and good prices & just up the street from the Comfort Inn. The hotel is in an excellent location if you want to be in walking distance of many restaurants, attractions, bars, the Greg Frewin THeatre (great dinner & show) and just down the hill are the falls! It is also right next to the Skywheel. If you head towards the Skylon through the parking lot you will enter another parking lot that leads you out to a main street and helps you to avoid all the traffic on Clifton Hill. The Skylon is also within walking distance.

reviews.title: Great Prise, Great Location, Great Staff.
reviews.text: The pool looked very nice, but my daughter said it was very cold. So they went in the hot tub. The breakfast buffet was a real money saver.
